LongDescription: Licensee was convicted of a misdemeanor and is currently incarcerated. No practice is permitted.
License is suspended following a felony conviction under Business and Professions Code section 2232.5. No practice is allowed while the license is suspended.
Licensee has signed an agreement in which licensee will limit his or her practice in a manner prescribed by the reviewing physician.

Petition to Revoke Probation Filed: A formal, public charge by the Board alleging a physician violated a term or condition of probation which has been referred to the Attorney General's Office for prosecution. Practice is permitted unless otherwise specified.

ShortDescription: Acc & Petition to Revoke Probation Filed
LongDescription: Accusation and Petition to Revoke Probation Filed: A formal, public charge by the Board alleging the physician violated the Medical Practice Act and violated a term or condition of probation. This is the result of a fully investigated complaint that has been referred to the Attorney General's Office for prosecution. Practice is permitted unless otherwise specified.
This is an administrative action taken by the Board at the time of licensure.
A citation and/or fine has been issued for a minor violation(s) of the law. This is not considered disciplinary action. This matter has been resolved.
Licensee was reprimanded for a minor violation(s) of the law. This is considered disciplinary action.
A citation and/or fine has been issued for a minor violation(s) of the law. This is not considered disciplinary action under California law but is an administrative action.

A formal, public charge by the Board alleging a physician violated the Medical Practice Act. This is the result of a fully investigated complaint that has been referred to the Attorney General's Office for prosecution. Practice is permitted unless otherwise specified.
A Decision has been ordered by the Board, however, the effective date is pending. For more information, see the Public Record Actions section below.
License has been revoked as a result of disciplinary action rendered by the Board.  No practice is permitted.

Probation is the result of disciplinary action.  Probation is ordered for a specified period of time during which the physician must comply with specified terms and conditions and report to a Board probation monitor.  Practice is permitted unless otherwise specified.  Probation has not been completed.
Licensee has been suspended. No practice is permitted.
License has been suspended pursuant to Business and Professions Code section 494.5. No practice is permitted. No public document is available.
Other disciplinary action. Contact the Central File Room for documents.
Licensee has surrendered his or her license to resolve a disciplinary action.  No practice is permitted.

ShortDescription: STAY ORDR ISSUED STOP EXEC. OF DECISION
LongDescription: The Board's decision has been stayed (put on hold) by Board pending its reconsideration or stayed by court pending judicial review.

ShortDescription: IF CERTAIN SPEC COND ARE MET  PROB BEGIN
LongDescription: Disciplinary decision rendered by the Board has a condition(s) that must be met prior to probation commencing as outlined in the decision. No practice is permitted until specified condition(s) are met.

Disciplinary decision rendered by the Board includes a period of probation and actual suspension as outlined in the decision. No practice is permitted while license is suspended. Probation has not been completed.
Non-completion of probation.
The Board's decision to impose discipline has been stayed (put on hold) by Board pending its reconsideration or stayed by court pending judicial review.

ShortDescription: PRACT TEMP RESTR/SUSP BY ADMIN LAW JUDGE
LongDescription: License's practice has been temporarily restricted or suspended by a court order. Limited or no practice allowed while suspension is in place.

ShortDescription: PRACT TEMP RESTR OR SUSP BY COURT JUDGE
LongDescription: Licensee's practice has been temporarily restricted or suspended by a court order. Limited or no practice allowed while suspension is in place.
Licensee suspended during incarceration following a felony conviction. No practice is allowed while the license is suspended.
Licensee's practice has been temporarily restricted or limited pursuant to a Court Order.
Licensee's practice has been temporarily restricted or limited pursuant to a court order.

ShortDescription: SUSP BY ANOTHER STATE OR FED GOVERNMENT
LongDescription: License suspended or revoked by another state or the federal government.
Limitations have been placed on the physician's practice.
The licensee's period of probation has been completed.
Licensee was convicted of a misdemeanor.
Licensee was convicted of a felony.

ShortDescription: Admin Action by Other State/Fed Gov't
LongDescription: Administrative Action Taken by Other State or Federal Government
A malpractice judgment has been rendered against the licensee by a civil court.

ShortDescription: HOSPITAL DISCIPLINE PER B&P CDE SECT 805
LongDescription: The action taken by the healthcare facility against the physician's staff privileges to provide healthcare services at this facility was for a medical disciplinary cause or reason.
A malpractice arbitration award has been rendered against the licensee by a neutral third party arbitrator.
The licensee has agreed to resolve malpractice claims.
License issued on a probationary basis subject to terms and conditions.  Practice is permitted unless otherwise specified.
Licensee is required to pay the full renewal fee but is exempt from complying with the continuing medical education requirements. No practice is permitted.
The licensee's period of probation has been completed.
